conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls extruded with thickness, angled/isometric perspective, multiple wall faces visible, and ceiling/roof removed to reveal interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion, readable room volumes, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification in some corner/partition detailing compared to plan.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall apartment footprint and central living/dining organization broadly match, but there appears to be a notable room-program mismatch (an extra bedroom-like space in the lower/foreground zone where the 2D plan reads as living/entry circulation), and some partition/door placements do not perfectly align with the 2D layout.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture types present (sofas, dining, beds) and bathrooms/kitchen elements included. Some room-to-furniture mapping likely deviates due to the apparent extra/relocated bedroom.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good visibility of walls/floors/openings; lighting supports reading the layout. Minor ambiguity in distinguishing some openings and exact door swings vs plan.

detected_errors.description: Room configuration/program does not fully match the 2D plan (a bedroom-like space appears in the lower/foreground area, suggesting an added/relocated room compared to the plan’s circulation/living arrangement).
Doors/windows/openings are not all verifiably on the exact walls or with the same proportions/orientation as the 2D plan (some placements appear approximated).
Some furniture placement likely follows the altered room mapping rather than the exact 2D room functions.

summary: A clear and valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong fundamentals, but with noticeable layout/program mismatches that reduce strict geometric fidelity to the 2D plan.
